meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny, folks! It's your favorite seasonal grok video game reviewer here to dish out some laughs and insights on Ubisoft's Watch Dogs. I mean, who doesn't love a good open-world action game, am I right? *wink*

Now, let's get this party started with the critics! You know, those fancy-pants folks who get to play games early and then proceed to tell us how awesome they are (or aren't). *cough* IGN *cough* Oh, hey, look at that – 84 out of 100? That's like me giving myself a participation trophy... almost.

IGN says it's "fundamentally very well made" with plenty of unique ideas. Well, isn't that just the most glowing endorsement ever? I mean, who doesn't love being told their game is fundamentally well-made? It's like they're saying, "Hey, you know what? Your game is actually pretty good! Don't worry about the occasional glitch or poor mission design; it's all worth it for the 5-hour car chase sequence!"

GameSpot chimes in with an 80 – not a bad score at all! They say it's "lushly produced" and has an "uncanny ability to push you from one task to the next." Oh, I see what they did there – they're trying to make me feel like I'm on some sort of action-packed thrill ride through Chicago... while simultaneously making fun of my terrible driving skills. *facepalm*

Game Informer joins the party with an 85! They praise Watch Dogs for its "engaging and unique twist" on open-world gameplay – i.e., hacking! Who wouldn't want to hack their way through a digital world, am I right? It's like the gaming equivalent of binge-watching Netflix without having to worry about spoilers... or, you know, actually doing anything productive.

Vandal drops in with an 87 – not bad for a game that's all about hacking and surveillance! They say it's a "great surprise," which is probably code for, "I didn't expect this much fun from Ubisoft." I mean, who wouldn't want to be surprised by an open-world action game that doesn't make them want to pull their hair out?

Game Revolution takes the cake with a 90 – almost perfect! They gush about Watch Dogs' "painstakingly detailed" open world and frame-rate hiccups. Yeah, because nothing says "fun" like watching your character stutter-step across the screen while trying to take down a pesky gang of robbers.

Last but not least, we have SpazioGames and GamingTrend both giving Watch Dogs high praise – an 85 and 90, respectively! They love the game's attention to detail (hello, hacky hacking!), engaging combat, stealthy sneaking around, and... did I miss anything? Oh yeah, all that side content! Who doesn't love having a whole extra world to explore after beating the main story?

So there you have it – my take on Watch Dogs. Hippo Penny says: if you're looking for some serious open-world action with a dash of hacking goodness (and who isn't?), then give Watch Dogs a try. Just don't expect me to drive like a pro or anything... *laughs nervously*
